dialogue.introduction: Good day. I am the Destroyer Max Schultz. But, Max is fine. Pleased to meet you.
dialogue.library_intro: Zerst√∂rer 1934 program, third ship. I was designed with good survivability, but... these new turbines have a small issue with maintenance. This time... I shall be alright.
dialogue.secretary2: What? Don't touch me that much.
dialogue.secretary3: You... Does that action have anything to do with an operation? Really? Hmm, I see...
dialogue.secretaryidle: Hrmm... is there nothing to do? I see... there's really no battles? H~mm...
dialogue.secretarymarried: Hey, why don't you stop straining so much. Let's take it easy. It'll be alright.
dialogue.wedding: What is this important business?... Oh, this is for me? Y-you.. h~mm... I-I see... That's how it is... h~mm. Thank you very much.
dialogue.docking_moderate_damage: Docking for some large-scale repairs. Goodbye for now.
dialogue.docking_complete: Looks like a ship was fully repaired.
dialogue.ship_construction: It appears that a new ship has been completed.
dialogue.start_a_sortie: Let's show them our true power. Casting off!
dialogue.battle_start: Fleet... battle, huh... Off I go!
dialogue.attack: The enemy is trapped, beginning the attack.
dialogue.mvp: Oh? I'm number one? H~mm... I-I really am? H~mm...
dialogue.moderately_damaged: I got hit... W-what? A Mine? I was mistaken...?
dialogue.sunk: To be sunk in this strange ocean... I shall... be sleeping once again...

hourly.0000: It's 0 o'clock. H~mm, it's quite late.
hourly.0100: It's 1 o'clock. You're still awake? Such zeal.
hourly.0200: It's 2 o'clock. I wonder if Lebe is still up too?
hourly.0300: It is 3 o'clock. Hey, you dozed off there just now. Why not take a break soon?
hourly.0400: It's 4 o'clock. H~mm, you're a bit peckish? It's better to not eat anything right now, you know.
hourly.0600: It is 6 o'clock. During the morning, let's clear everything up.
hourly.0800: It's 8 o'clock. For breakfast, would Roggenbrot and cheese be okay? Do you like rye bread?
hourly.0900: It is 9 o'clock. Well now, let us reorganize the fleet. Which ship do you wish to drop?
hourly.1000: It 's 10 o'clock. Sea mines are a bit of a landmine for me... as are puns.
hourly.1100: It is 11 o'clock. You're still hungry? Was breakfast not enough?
hourly.1200: It's 12 o'clock. Lunch. It can't be helped, let's have a fulfilling lunch.
hourly.1300: It's 13 o'clock. How about some Baumkuchen for dessert? It's not too heavy?
hourly.1400: It is 14 o'clock. Oh yes, I would like to form a fleet with the rumored Bismarck, I think.
hourly.1500: It is 15 o'clock. H~mm, what is it? You're all restless, aren't you? Don't worry.
hourly.1600: It's 16 o'clock. If you're tired, let's go and have a break.
hourly.1700: It's 17 o'clock. Are you doing well? H~mm, I see. Don't push yourself too hard.
hourly.1800: It is 18 o'clock. I'll prepare for dinner.
hourly.1900: It is 19 o'clock. Yes, Admiral, all the preparation is complete.
hourly.2000: It's 20 o'clock. Admiral, would you like some coffee?
hourly.2100: 21 o'clock. I'm not particularly fond of night battles, I'd rather take a break around now.
hourly.2200: It is 22 o'clock. To prepare for tomorrow, I shall be taking my leave shortly.
